did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
Mark Miller and Benmarl Winery Collection
[bulk] 1970-1990.
did.physdesc: Audio Recordings, Correspondence, Newspapers Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications, Video
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection includes information about Benmarl and Mark Miller.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Benmarl uses the slogan America's Oldest Vineyard. The winery is located in the Hudson Valley. Mark Miller and family took over the estate in 1957 naming it Benmarl. Ben is Gaelic for hill and marl describes soil. Miller helped lobby to pass winery legislation in New York. Benmarl holds N.Y. State Farm Winery Act license #1. Miller is also a noted wardrobe designer, illustrator and author.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection includes information about Benmarl, press kits, publication clippings, photographs other ephemera. Drafts of Mark Miller's book For the Love of Wine. Speeches given by Mark Miller about the wine industry and legislation. Videos and audio tapes regarding the winery. Information on the Benmarl Societe des Vignerons. Also some artwork by Miller. Farm Winery License FW1 and the pen used by Governor Hugh Carey to sign the act.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Mark Miller and Benmarl Winery Collection #6716. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: A proof and first edition copy of Mark Miller's book, Wine a Gentleman's Game, the adventures of an amateur winemaker turned professional, are available in Rare call number TP557 .M64 1984.
Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)
